North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing

incorporation_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Business Registration Division
charitable_registration_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing Section
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with contributions under $25,000 annually are generally exempt from charitable registration. Religious organizations and certain others are also exempt, but must apply for exemption.

formation_requirements.notes: North Carolina requires a registered agent with a physical North Carolina address. Uniquely, NC allows single-director nonprofits. The registered agent can be an individual or a business entity.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Business Registration Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by the 15th day of the anniversary month of incorporation
required_information: Registered agent name and office address
Names and addresses of directors and principal officers
requirements.notes: Filing fee is $25. No late fee but failure to file results in administrative dissolution. Due on 15th of anniversary month.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Before soliciting contributions in North Carolina
requirements.form_number: Form CSL-1-CO - Charitable Organization License Application
required_information: List of officers, directors, and trustees
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Initial license fee is $200. Organizations with contributions under $25,000 may apply for exemption instead of license. License must be obtained before soliciting.

requirements.requirement_name: Annual License Renewal and Financial Report
requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end
requirements.form_number: Form CSL-2-CO - Annual Renewal and Financial Report
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual renewal fee is $200. Organizations that fall below $25,000 threshold may convert to exempt status. Late filing may result in license suspension.

requirements.requirement_name: Streamlined Sales Tax Certificate of Exemption
requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form E-595E - Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Certificate of Exemption
requirements.notes: North Carolina 501(c)(3) organizations are generally exempt from sales tax on purchases for charitable purposes. Use Form E-595E to claim exemption at point of sale. Not all purchases are exempt - review specific exemptions.

requirements.due_date_specifics: File during listing period (January 1 - January 31) before tax year
requirements.form_number: Form AV-10 - Property Tax Exemption Application
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable, educational, or religious purposes. Once granted, exemption continues if use remains qualifying. Contact county assessor for specific requirements.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Department of Revenue - License and Theft Bureau
requirements.due_date_specifics: File application at least 30 days before raffle event
required_information: Proof of 5+ years continuous operation in North Carolina
List of officers and raffle operators
requirements.notes: North Carolina allows two raffles per year for qualifying nonprofits in existence for 5+ years. Maximum prize value $25,000 per raffle, $50,000 aggregate per year. License is free but strictly regulated.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Department of Revenue - License and Theft Bureau
requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for two years; renew biennially
required_information: Proof of 5+ years continuous operation in North Carolina
List of officers and bingo operators
requirements.notes: Bingo license valid for 2 years. Organization must be in existence for 5+ years. Quarterly financial reports required. Strict prize limits and operational rules apply.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial license date
required_information: List of officers and persons involved in solicitation
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional solicitors who solicit on behalf of charities. Each contract must be filed before solicitation begins. Bond must remain in effect throughout license period.

requirements.filing_agency: North Carolina Secretary of State - Solicitation Licensing Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial license date
requirements.form_number: Form CSL-1-FC - Fundraising Consultant License Application
requirements.notes: Fundraising consultants provide advice but do not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed before providing services.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and may be required for CSL-2-CO filing
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before annual renewal)
requirements.notes: North Carolina requires audited financial statements for organizations with gross revenue over $1,000,000 OR that pay professional solicitors more than $300,000. Organizations between $100,000-$1,000,000 should have financial review. Audit must be performed by independent CPA.

special_notes.single_director_allowed: North Carolina uniquely allows nonprofit corporations to have just one director, unlike most states that require at least three. This provides flexibility for small organizations.
special_notes.high_license_fees: North Carolina's $200 annual license fee for charities and professional fundraisers is among the highest in the nation. Budget accordingly for compliance costs.
special_notes.five_year_gaming_rule: Organizations must be in continuous operation for 5 years before conducting raffles or bingo. This is longer than most states and presents a barrier for newer nonprofits.
special_notes.raffle_prize_limits: North Carolina limits raffles to 2 per year with maximum prize of $25,000 each ($50,000 aggregate). This is more restrictive than many states.
special_notes.exemption_application_required: Even organizations exempt from licensing (under $25,000) must apply for exemption status. Exemption is not automatic.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying activities. North Carolina reinforces these federal limits.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with professional solicitors or fundraising consultants must be filed with the Secretary of State before solicitation or consulting begins.
special_notes.audit_threshold: North Carolina's $1,000,000 audit threshold is relatively high compared to other states. Additional threshold of $300,000 paid to professional solicitors also triggers audit requirement.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. Secretary of State should be notified of dissolution plans.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and North Carolina Corporate Income Tax Return (Form CD-405) if conducting business in North Carolina.
special_notes.biennial_bingo: Bingo licenses are valid for two years, reducing administrative burden compared to annual licensing in other states.
special_notes.streamlined_sales_tax: North Carolina participates in the Streamlined Sales Tax system. Organizations can use Form E-595E for exemption claims.
special_notes.property_tax_timing: Property tax exemption applications must be filed during the January listing period. Missing this window delays exemption for a full year.
